title: If fixed your stupid promo, Riot, you are welcome.

embed.description: The disclaimer they forgot to add is there in this version.

body: The original version lacked the necessary medical disclaimer at the end.

replies.body:
Damn.

I hate it too when I irrevokably lose my soul and turn into a homunculus.

> [{quoted}](name=Warlord Rhinark,realm=EUW,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-11-15T09:22:46.536+0000)
>
> Damn.
> 
> I hate it too when I irrevokably lose my soul and turn into a homunculus.

I imagine it can't be too pleasant.
Actually it's a real weight off your shoulders.  Souls are surprisingly heavy.

I know the trailer was supposed to be light-mooded, but it is incredible they actually consider six Wit's Ends as experimentating with meta while it could be reported for trolling. Legit If I was spineless I'd just go on troll spree and defend myself with "Is it meta? I'm just trying to figure out as Rito ad told me".

Also at current meta it feels like buying one Wit's End is already trolling. Like who even buys that? If any other class needs MR they always seems to buy something better (actual tank item, Maw, Banshees). If ADCs get so desperate they buy MR they usually do so also due to hard CC and go for QS instead.

Changing meta is not just player's job to go troll, it also requires the game to be fixed by developers.

EDIT: On the other hand there is mild chance the promo wasn't official... Or?

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-11-15T15:18:10.863+0000)
>
> I know the trailer was supposed to be light-mooded, but it is incredible they actually consider six Wit's Ends as experimentating with meta while it could be reported for trolling. Legit If I was spineless I'd just go on troll spree and defend myself with "Is it meta? I'm just trying to figure out as Rito ad told me".
> 
> Also at current meta it feels like buying one Wit's End is already trolling. Like who even buys that? If any other class needs MR they always seems to buy something better (actual tank item, Maw, Banshees). If ADCs get so desperate they buy MR they usually do so also due to hard CC and go for QS instead.
> 
> Changing meta is not just player's job to go troll, it also requires the game to be fixed by developers.
> 
> EDIT: On the other hand there is mild chance the promo wasn't official... Or?

It’s a solid item on many champions.

All guinsoo’s champions aside from Yi will consider it. It is fairly decent on irelia, jax, and teemo, and there are yet a few others who build it occasionally.
The difference is building one {{item:3091}} vs 6.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000400010001,timestamp=2018-11-15T22:54:59.456+0000)
>
> The difference is building one {{item:3091}} vs 6.

I was replying to the guy who said even getting 1 was basically trolling.
Ahh my mistake.  Still the official video is a bit of a troll haha.

> [{quoted}](name=Pierce The Veal,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2018-11-15T19:38:02.984+0000)
>
> It’s a solid item on many champions.
> 
> All guinsoo’s champions aside from Yi will consider it. It is fairly decent on irelia, jax, and teemo, and there are yet a few others who build it occasionally.

It's honestly not that bad on Yi

> [{quoted}](name=Jąsper,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2018-11-15T21:06:54.125+0000)
>
> It's honestly not that bad on Yi

It’s not. It’s just that he often prefers ad and doesn’t really have much magic damage on hit, so the mr reduction is wasted on him. But yeah, not really that bad.

I haven't really seen Irelia or Jax that would build it.

But Teemo (and Kog and Kayle as suggested by Maelrus) did slip my mind, they make sense.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000400010002,timestamp=2018-11-15T23:52:01.463+0000)
>
> I haven't really seen Irelia or Jax that would build it.
> 
> But Teemo (and Kog and Kayle as suggested by Maelrus) did slip my mind, they make sense.

Go on irelia and jax mains reddits. They do bring up building it situationally and whatnot. It’s a fairly good item, it adds its own on hit, and augments irelia and jax’s built in magic damage while giving them attack speed and magic resist. Against the right team it is by far a great item.
Mid Irelia was rushing it first item in some worlds matchups to survive Lane.

Witts End is a solid item on Yi if you are against a comp that has an AP mid / Jg / Supprt ( brand support )... In that case I would usually go blood razor ---> Witts End ---> Ninja Tabis ---> Rageblade ---> 2 tank items.  

Worked very well for me this season on Yi for ranked games.  Think I had around a 55-65% win ratio season wide on Yi depending on which account you look at.

> [{quoted}](name=Ýisus,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000400010003,timestamp=2018-11-16T00:32:51.646+0000)
>
> Witts End is a solid item on Yi if you are against a comp that has an AP mid / Jg / Supprt ( brand support )... In that case I would usually go blood razor ---> Witts End ---> Ninja Tabis ---> Rageblade ---> 2 tank items.  
> 
> Worked very well for me this season on Yi for ranked games.  Think I had around a 55-65% win ratio season wide on Yi depending on which account you look at.

Yep he uses it decently well, though he often considers hexdrinker before he considers wits end. Really depends on enemy team comp though.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-11-15T15:18:10.863+0000)
 
> Also at current meta it feels like buying one Wit's End is already trolling. Like who even buys that? 

Well, Kayle is a regular user. Kog, Yi and other Rageblade user can get it. I even get it on Shen sometimes. Its one of the best duelist/mr items in the game, 70 Mr, AS and 42 on hit damage are not bad
I always figured it went without saying that hey guys, maybe _ask_ your team before trying your wacky zacky new build/champ position.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-11-15T19:38:17.414+0000)
>
> I always figured it went without saying that hey guys, maybe _ask_ your team before trying your wacky zacky new build/champ position.

What game have you been playing? People are trolling all over the place even without this kind of incitement, which they take as full on legitimization of dirping around.

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2018-11-15T20:40:42.167+0000)
>
> What game have you been playing? People are trolling all over the place even without this kind of incitement, which they take as full on legitimization of dirping around.

Shrug, then you report them.

It was generally/always an unspoken rule that you asked before you locked something in if it was odd, offmeta or downright obtuse. If you didn't ask, it was fully liable that you can/would be reported. Same way it always was.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2018-11-15T22:35:18.256+0000)
>
> Shrug,

For the first n+1 times. After which it becomes a level of annoyance that's beyond shrug offable.

> then you report them.

Sure we do, but to no avail. Troll picking in Riot's eyes is just "strategy".

> It was generally/always an unspoken rule that you asked before you locked something in if it was odd, offmeta or downright obtuse. If you didn't ask, it was fully liable that you can/would be reported. Same way it always was.

That's the culture that I long for but have never seen since the 5 years I've been playing this game. And the fact that the reports are meaningless make the whole idea an unrealistic utopia until something is done on Riot's side. The best the player base can do is report.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-11-15T19:38:17.414+0000)
>
> I always figured it went without saying that hey guys, maybe _ask_ your team before trying your wacky zacky new build/champ position.

Here’s the thing: 9.8 out of 10 times they say no or say nothing THEN complain after the fact.

NA is particularly notorious for hating experimentation. The Korean server is the ‘end-all, be-all’ to most players here. Yet these same people cannot grasp the concept that meta shifts due to new builds coming from other regions is baaaauuse...they actually experiment!

True, there is still trolling or reluctance to let people go something different outside of NA but they don’t go nuclear meltdown crybaby mode because of these things.

Like when Nautilus was professionally picked up as support for a while. I played that; hell, TONS of players played that but got mercilessly flamed and the naysayers had hate hard-ons.

As soon as that one guy picked him on the competitive scene, those same angry people changed their opinions faster than the public in ‘1942’.

People (generally) are stupid. In exactly which ways will always vary but I take zero stock in people potentially saying ‘yes’ to letting others try to innovate.

> [{quoted}](name=BabiesNeedToDie,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00070002,timestamp=2018-11-16T00:21:34.030+0000)
>
> Here’s the thing: 9.8 out of 10 times they say no or say nothing THEN complain after the fact.

Then your opportunity to do the goofy stuff should be that 2%.

> NA is particularly notorious for hating experimentation. The Korean server is the ‘end-all, be-all’ to most players here. Yet these same people cannot grasp the concept that meta shifts due to new builds coming from other regions is baaaauuse...they actually experiment!

5:40 in this video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gnl-h52cDEs

> True, there is still trolling or reluctance to let people go something different outside of NA but they don’t go nuclear meltdown crybaby mode because of these things.

Maybe they don't have to deal with selfish trolls bringing their damaging nonsense screwing up the game once every two goddamn games. Not trolling your team should be a basic fucking tenet of team play and yet people calling the trolls out are for some reason talked about in a manner like you do in the quote above.

> Like when Nautilus was professionally picked up as support for a while. I played that; hell, TONS of players played that but got mercilessly flamed and the naysayers had hate hard-ons.

You know what I also fucking saw a lot back in the day? Vel instead of support, Voli instead of support, fucking Veigar, the anti-thesis of a support instead of a support. 99% of the shit people do under the label of "experimenting" is just plain idiocy brought on by selfishness and a system where this behavior is guaranteed to go unpunished. There are proper circumstances under which you can experiment, in solo queue with people who don't want to be experimented on is not one.

> As soon as that one guy picked him on the competitive scene, those same angry people changed their opinions faster than the public in ‘1942’.
> 
> People (generally) are stupid. In exactly which ways will always vary but I take zero stock in people potentially saying ‘yes’ to letting others try to innovate.

No, you can't call trolling innovating. 99.9% of the time it's some asshole not wanting to play the role they got just not doing it because he feels entitled to troll. If people were really trying to innovate they wouldn't do it in an inconsiderate and anti-team manner. They wouldn't be doing obviously moronic stuff. Innovating is when somebody with a deep knowledge of the game notices something that might work on a theoretical level and puts it to the test. It starts with a level of understanding deep enough to propel a player to higher tier play on its own. Some jackwit moron instalocking Soraka instead of an adc in Bronze is not an innovator, he's a menace.

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000700020000,timestamp=2018-11-16T10:02:43.122+0000)
>
> Then your opportunity to do the goofy stuff should be that 2%.
> 
> 5:40 in this video:
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gnl-h52cDEs
> 
> Maybe they don't have to deal with selfish trolls bringing their damaging nonsense screwing up the game once every two goddamn games. Not trolling your team should be a basic fucking tenet of team play and yet people calling the trolls out are for some reason talked about in a manner like you do in the quote above.
> 
> You know what I also fucking saw a lot back in the day? Vel instead of support, Voli instead of support, fucking Veigar, the anti-thesis of a support instead of a support. 99% of the shit people do under the label of "experimenting" is just plain idiocy brought on by selfishness and a system where this behavior is guaranteed to go unpunished. There are proper circumstances under which you can experiment, in solo queue with people who don't want to be experimented on is not one.
> 
> No, you can't call trolling innovating. 99.9% of the time it's some asshole not wanting to play the role they got just not doing it because he feels entitled to troll. If people were really trying to innovate they wouldn't do it in an inconsiderate and anti-team manner. They wouldn't be doing obviously moronic stuff. Innovating is when somebody with a deep knowledge of the game notices something that might work on a theoretical level and puts it to the test. It starts with a level of understanding deep enough to propel a player to higher tier play on its own. Some jackwit moron instalocking Soraka instead of an adc in Bronze is not an innovator, he's a menace.

Not trying to justify the total opposite end of the spectrum but thanks for the colossal assumption. It really shows just how many people are so quick to willingly put on horse blinders.

> [{quoted}](name=BabiesNeedToDie,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0007000200000000,timestamp=2018-11-17T04:47:04.832+0000)
>
> Not trying to justify the total opposite end of the spectrum but thanks for the colossal assumption. It really shows just how many people are so quick to willingly put on horse blinders.

I didn't make assumptions, I directly addressed exactly what you wrote. To which you responded by ignoring the whole thing in its entirety and posting this nonsense. Congrats.

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00070002000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-17T07:36:13.662+0000)
>
> I didn't make assumptions, I directly addressed exactly what you wrote. To which you responded by ignoring the whole thing in its entirety and posting this nonsense. Congrats.

You “directed” them through examples EXCLUSIVELY aimed using absolutes targeted towards those who abuse the grey-is-not-grey-but-Riot-doesn’t-do-much area of things.

I at least acknowledge not everyone’s innocent, though admittedly it is somewhat downplayed as I attempt to not assume that people are garbage human beings without being shown that they may just lose perspective or there’s a breakdown in communication.

Yeah, there’s people no one wants to feel oppressed by for the sake of having to “deal with” only THEM having fun. But these people go up and beyond the call of duty to rub it in everyone’s face.

This is not stupid (which everyone can be in their own way). This is simple greed and self-interest.

> [{quoted}](name=BabiesNeedToDie,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000700020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-17T14:56:26.747+0000)
>
> You “directed” them through examples EXCLUSIVELY aimed using absolutes targeted towards those who abuse the grey-is-not-grey-but-Riot-doesn’t-do-much area of things.

Huh? Directed what? What the hell are you even talking about?

> I at least acknowledge not everyone’s innocent, though admittedly it is somewhat downplayed as I attempt to not assume that people are garbage human beings without being shown that they may just lose perspective or there’s a breakdown in communication.

Read back what you wrote before you try to sell it as something completely different.
For the sake of clarity here's a guide through:
- First you present an ass pull ratio of how often you think people are okay with others experimenting on them.
- Then you invoke the age old discovery argument.
- Then you call not being fine with goofers "trolling" and calling them out being a"nuclear meltdown crybaby".
- Then you try to support the discovery argument by listing an example of a discovery like a chump.
- Then you claimed that the reason public opinion flipped on support Naut was because he was once picked in pro play.
- Then you said that people generally are stupid and that you don't care whether people agree when you want to troll and called trolling innovating in the process.

That is the sum total of what you said, not that little fiction you say it was here.

> Yeah, there’s people no one wants to feel oppressed by for the sake of having to “deal with” only THEM having fun. But these people go up and beyond the call of duty to rub it in everyone’s face.

No, most pick trolls just do it and try not to even make a big deal of it.

> This is not stupid (which everyone can be in their own way). This is simple greed and self-interest.

Yeah, though I'd use "selfishness" instead of "self-interest" there.

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0007000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-18T11:33:50.566+0000)
>
> Huh? Directed what? What the hell are you even talking about?

You used the word 'directly' and have no idea what I'm talking about when I refer to it? Isn't that in itself an admission that you can't even keep up with what you're going on about?

I'm okay with that people are privvy to change their opinions based on new information but you really just want to argue for the sake of arguing (okay, okay, pretty sure we're both guilty of that considering it's the internet and there's little to no consequence for trying or not trying to make sense of anything anyone has to say) so I'm just going to walk away from this because this one little thing alone is eating at me and if I'm getting the impression (regardless of it being the actual fact or not) you may just be paying attention to certain biased facets of your argument and pretending the flaws don't exist, there's no common ground to be found here.

> [{quoted}](name=BabiesNeedToDie,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00070002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-18T18:32:03.482+0000)
>
> You used the word 'directly' and have no idea what I'm talking about when I refer to it? Isn't that in itself an admission that you can't even keep up with what you're going on about?

First of all, congrats on picking up on the most important part of what I said and ignoring everything else, I'm glad we can focus on this. Lol. Secondly, "directly" means I addressed specifically what you said rather than inferrences or associated topics. "to direct" is a verb, meaning to target something at something else. If you can't differentiate between two freaking words, you aren't in any position to question my ability to follow the conversation.

> I'm okay with that people are privvy to change their opinions based on new information

That's not the norm.

> but you really just want to argue for the sake of arguing

That would be one of the points of online message boards...

> (okay, okay, pretty sure we're both guilty of that considering it's the internet and there's little to no consequence for trying or not trying to make sense of anything anyone has to say)

Huh?

> so I'm just going to walk away from this because this one little thing alone is eating at me and if I'm getting the impression (regardless of it being the actual fact or not) you may just be paying attention to certain biased facets of your argument and pretending the flaws don't exist, there's no common ground to be found here.

Dude you've been rambling on the edge between the realms of barely sensible arguments and pure nonsense while straight up _**ignoring**_ most of what I said. You accusing me of not listening to your arguments and taking a narrow minded approach is so ironic that I'm starting to get scared you will be getting hemochromatosis.

At *best* it's a disclaimer in champ select.

"Going AP Ez"
"No AP on the team, so I'm doing Viktor Bot"

If a teammate wants more explanation than that then they probably need to spend more time figuring out what abilities/items/runes do in detail, and there's just not enough time for that kind of discussion *and* to change plans all around.
Oh cool, they finally noticed you can play champions "off-role"

> [{quoted}](name=Blenos,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2018-11-16T02:13:59.604+0000)
>
> Oh cool, they finally noticed you can play champions "off-role"

Not with random people on your team who just want to play normally. That's the whole point.

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000e0000,timestamp=2018-11-16T09:40:47.451+0000)
>
> Not with random people on your team who just want to play normally. That's the whole point.

Oh so are they noticing matching 5 randoms together and expecting them to work together is not how it actually works?

> [{quoted}](name=Blenos,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2018-11-17T01:18:23.632+0000)
>
> Oh so are they noticing matching 5 randoms together and expecting them to work together is not how it actually works?

Well, that's how it normally works, they are advocating here for players to sabotage that.
lmao tru
aHHAHHAHAHHAHAHA NICE

Yeah.
You see, I have no problem with people trying stuff in normals. However, I would like you to tell the team of your intentions _before_ the game starts so people can leave if they want to. That, or just try stuff out with your friends so I don't get stuck in a game with you.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-11-15T22:39:28.587+0000)
>
> Yeah.
> You see, I have no problem with people trying stuff in normals. However, I would like you to tell the team of your intentions _before_ the game starts so people can leave if they want to. That, or just try stuff out with your friends so I don't get stuck in a game with you.

It's not on people who just want to play normally to take the dodge penalty so they wouldn't be trolled. It's on everybody to be responsible and not troll in the first place.

Wait, so this is where the malph mumu bot lane came from?

Just faced them earlier, literally all three other players on their team afk'd...
Funny. You have a typo though. You wrote is instead of if.

> [{quoted}](name=The Space Cowboy,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-11-15T21:48:19.092+0000)
>
> Funny. You have a typo though. You wrote is instead of if.

You're right :( Good catch.
Ok. That was actually pretty funny.
Immediately after the promo I had a Diana on the enemy team buying only Wit's End against our Nasus. Good game for us but the enemy team was no happy. Cause and effect is a strong drug.
Agreed, picking AP {{champion:102}} top will cause your teammate to be become very toxic, unless u carry them.
AP shyvana OP, but doesn't fair well in the current meta top. Jungle is a better place for it.
ahahaha

I swear i thought i heard "hummus" rather than homuculus...
Now i'm hungry!

> [{quoted}](name=King Lego,realm=EUNE,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-11-15T20:00:39.010+0000)
>
> I swear i thought i heard "hummus" rather than homuculus...
> Now i'm hungry!

Sorry, shitty pronunciation because of the accent. I hope you had some hummus available so the craving could be satisfied. :)

> [{quoted}](name=zoliking,realm=NA,application-id=EBBIvmVK,discussion-id=yopnL0o4,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-11-15T20:42:00.847+0000)
>
> Sorry, shitty pronunciation because of the accent. I hope you had some hummus available so the craving could be satisfied. :)

I live in Lebanon.
These things are literally everywhere.
lolololololol
